member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCard
member.summary: A vCard object for exchanging personal contact information.

remarks.para: A vCard contains personal information, such as postal addresses, public security certificates, email addresses, and web sites. The vCard specification makes it possible for different computer programs to exchange personal contact information; for example, a vCard can be attached to an email or sent over a wireless connection.

The standard vCard format is a text file with properties in name:value format. However, there are multiple versions of this format as well as compatible alternatives in XML and HTML formats. This class library aims to accomodate these variations but be aware some some formats do not support all possible properties.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCard.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCard.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Loads a new instance of the class from a text reader.
member.param: An initialized text reader.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCard.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a new instance of the class from a text file.
member.param: The path to a text file containing vCard data in any recognized vCard format.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCard.ToString
member.summary: Builds a string that represents the vCard.
member.returns: The formatted name of the contact person, if defined, or the default object.ToString().

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.AccessClassification
member.summary: The security access classification of the vCard owner (e.g. private).

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.AdditionalNames
member.summary: Any additional (e.g. middle) names of the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Categories
member.remarks: This property is a collection of strings containing keywords or category names.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Certificates
member.summary: Public key certificates attached to the vCard.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.DeliveryAddresses
member.summary: Delivery addresses associated with the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Department
member.summary: The department of the person in the organization.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the vCard.
member.remarks: This property is used by vCard applications for titles, headers, and other visual elements.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.EmailAddresses
member.summary: A collection of objects for the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.FamilyName
member.summary: The family (last) name of the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.FormattedName
member.summary: The formatted name of the person.
member.remarks: This property allows the name of the person to be written in a manner specific to his or her culture. The formatted name is not required to strictly correspond with the family name, given name, etc.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Gender
member.remarks: The vCard specification does not define a property to indicate the gender of the contact. Microsoft Outlook implements it as a custom property named X-WAB-GENDER.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.GivenName
member.summary: The given (first) name of the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude of the person in decimal degrees.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude of the person in decimal degrees.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Mailer
member.summary: The mail software used by the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Nicknames
member.summary: A collection of nicknames for the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Notes
member.summary: A collection of notes or comments.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Office
member.summary: The office of the person at the organization.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Organization
member.summary: The organization or company of the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Photos
member.summary: A collection of photographic images embedded or referenced by the vCard.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.ProductId
member.summary: The name of the product that generated the vCard.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.RevisionDate
member.summary: The revision date of the vCard.
member.remarks: The revision date is not automatically updated by the vCard when modifying properties. It is up to the developer to change the revision date as needed.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Role
member.summary: The role of the person (e.g. Executive).
member.remarks: The role is shown as "Profession" in Microsoft Outlook.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Sources
member.summary: Directory sources for the vCard information.
member.remarks: A vCard may contain zero or more sources. A source identifies a directory that contains (or provided) information found in the vCard. A program can hypothetically connect to the source in order to obtain updated information.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.TimeZone
member.summary: A string identifying the time zone of the entity represented by the vCard.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Title
member.summary: The job title of the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.UniqueId
member.summary: A value that uniquely identifies the vCard.
member.remarks: This value is optional. The string must be any string that can be used to uniquely identify the vCard. The usage of the field is determined by the software. Typical possibilities for a unique string include a URL, a GUID, or an LDAP directory path. However, there is no particular standard dictated by the vCard specification.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.Websites
member.summary: Web sites associated with the person.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCard.SocialProfiles
member.summary: SocialProfile collection for the vCard in the X-SOCIALPROFILE property

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardAccessClassification
member.summary: The access classification of a vCard.
member.remarks: The access classification defines the intent of the vCard owner.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardAccessClassification.Public
member.summary: The vCard is classified as public.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardAccessClassification.Private
member.summary: The vCard is classified as private.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardAccessClassification.Confidential
member.summary: The vCard is classified as confidential.

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardCertificate
member.summary: A certificate attached to a vCard.

remarks.para: A vCard can be associated with a public key or authentication certificate. This is typically a public X509 certificate that allows people to use the key for validating messages.

The raw certificate data stored as a byte array.

member.summary: Creates a vCard certificate based on an X509 certificate.
member.param: An initialized X509 certificate.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardCertificate.Data
member.summary: The raw data of the certificate as a byte array.
member.remarks: Most certificates consist of 8-bit binary data that is encoded into a text format using BASE64 or a similar system. This property provides access to the computer-friendly, decoded data.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardCertificate.KeyType
member.summary: A short string that identifies the type of certificate.
member.remarks: The most common type is X509.

member.remarks: Most vCard email addresses are Internet email addresses. However, the vCard specification allows other email address formats, such as CompuServe and X400. Unless otherwise specified, an address is assumed to be an Internet address.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardEmailAddressCollection.GetFirstChoice(Thought.vCards.vCardEmailAddressType)
member.summary: Locates the first email address of the specified type while giving preference to email addresses marked as preferred.
member.param: The type of email address to locate. This can be any combination of values from .
member.returns: The function returns the first preferred email address that matches the specified type. If the collection does not contain a preferred email address, then it will return the first non-preferred matching email address. The function returns null if no matches were found.

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardGender
member.summary: The gender (male or female) of the contact.

remarks.para: Gender is not directly supported by the vCard specification. It is recognized by Microsoft Outlook and the Windows Address Book through an extended property called X-WAB-GENDER. This property has a value of 1 for women and 2 for men.

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardPhoto
member.summary: A photo embedded in a vCard.

remarks.para: You must specify the photo using a path, a byte array, or a System.Drawing.Bitmap instance. The class will extract the underlying raw bytes for storage into the vCard. You can call the function to create a new Windows bitmap object (e.g. for display on a form) or to extract the raw bytes (e.g. for transmission from a web page).

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardPhoto.data
member.summary: The raw bytes of the image data.
member.remarks: The raw bytes can be passed directly to the photo object or fetched from a file or remote URL. A .NET bitmap object can also be specified, in which case the constructor will load the raw bytes from the bitmap.

member.summary: Loads a photograph from an array of bytes.
member.param: An array of bytes containing the raw data from any of the supported image formats.

member.summary: Creates a new vCard photo from an image file.
member.param: The path to an image of any supported format.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardPhoto.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Creates a new vCard photo from an existing Bitmap object.
member.param: A bitmap to be attached to the vCard as a photo.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardPhoto.Fetch
member.remarks: This is a simple utility method for accessing the image referenced by the URL. For asynchronous or advanced loading you will need to download the image yourself and load the bytes directly into the class.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardPhoto.GetBitmap
member.summary: Creates a Bitmap object from the photo data.
member.remarks: An initialized Bitmap object. An exception is raised if the .NET framework is unable to identify the format of the image data, or if the format is not supported.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardPhoto.GetBytes
member.summary: Returns a copy of the raw bytes of the image.
member.returns: A byte array containing the raw bytes of the image.
member.remarks: A copy of the raw bytes are returned. Modifying the array will not modify the photo.

remarks.para: A vCard property specifies a single piece of information, such as an email address or telephone number. A property can also specify meta-data like a revision number. A full vCards is basically a collection of properties structured into a computer-friendly text format.

A property has a name, a value, and optionally one or more subproperties. A subproperty provides additional information about the property (such as the encoding used to store the value). The format of a value depends on the property and in some cases may be broken into multiple values.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardProperty.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a object with the specified name and a null value.
member.param: The name of the property.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardProperty.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a object with the specified name and value.
member.remarks: The vCard specification supports multiple values in certain fields, such as the N field. The value specified in this constructor is loaded as the first value.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardProperty.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a vCardProperty with the specified name, value and group.
member.param: The name of the vCard property.
The value of the vCard property.
The group name of the vCard property.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardProperty.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a with the specified name and a byte array as a value.
member.param: The name of the property.
The value as a byte array.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardProperty.#ctor(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates a with the specified name and date/time as a value.
member.param: The name of the property.
The date/time value.

member.summary: The name of the property (e.g. TEL).

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardReader
member.summary: An abstract reader for vCard and vCard-like file formats.

remarks.para: The property is a string collection containing a description of each warning encountered during the read process. An implementor of a card reader should populate this collection as the vCard data is being parsed.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardReader.warnings
member.summary: Stores the warnings issued by the implementor of the vCard reader. Currently warnings are simple string messages; a future version will store line numbers, severity levels, etc.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardReader.Read(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Reads a vCard from the specified input stream.
member.param: A text reader that points to the beginning of a vCard in the format expected by the implementor.
member.returns: An initialized object.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardReader.ReadInto(Thought.vCards.vCard,System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Reads vCard information from a text reader and populates into an existing vCard object.
member.param: An initialized vCard object.
A text reader containing vCard data in the format expected by the card reader class.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardReader.Warnings
member.remarks: Reseved for future use.

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardSource
member.summary: A source of directory information for a vCard.

remarks.para: A source identifies a directory that contains or provided information for the vCard. A source consists of a URI and a context. The URI is generally a URL; the context identifies the protocol and type of URI. For example, a vCard associated with an LDAP directory entry will have an ldap:// URL and a context of "LDAP".

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardSource.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the vCardSource class.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardSource.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes a new source with the specified URI.
member.param: The URI of the directory entry.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardSource.#ctor(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new source with the specified context and URI.
member.param: The URI of the source of the vCard data.
The context of the source.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardSource.Context
member.summary: The context of the source URI.
member.remarks: The context identifies how the URI should be interpreted. Example is "LDAP", which indicates the URI is an LDAP reference.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardSourceCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter
member.summary: Implements the standard vCard 2.1 and 3.0 text formats.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardWriter.Write(Thought.vCards.vCard,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes a vCard to an I/O stream using the format implemented by the class.
member.param: The vCard to write the I/O string.
The text writer to use for output.
member.remarks: The implementor should not close or flush the stream. The caller owns the stream and may not wish for the stream to be closed (e.g. the caller may call the function again with a different vCard).

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardWriter.Write(Thought.vCards.vCard,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the vCard to the specified filename.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardWriter.Warnings
member.summary: A collection of warning messages that were generated during the output of a vCard.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.standardEscapedCharacters
member.summary: The characters that are escaped per the original vCard specification.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.outlookEscapedCharacters
member.summary: The characters that are escaped by Microsoft Outlook.
member.remarks: Microsoft Outlook does not property decode escaped commas in values.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the standard writer.
member.remarks: The standard writer is configured to create vCard files in the highest supported version. This is currently version 3.0.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.BuildProperties(Thought.vCards.vCard)
member.summary: Builds a collection of standard properties based on the specified vCard.
member.returns: A that contains all properties for the current vCard, including the header and footer properties.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.EncodeBase64(System.Byte)

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.EmbedInternetImages
member.summary: Indicates whether images that reference Internet URLs should be embedded in the output. If not, then a URL is written instead.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.EmbedLocalImages
member.summary: Indicates whether or not references to local images should be embedded in the vCard. If not, then a local file reference is written instead.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.Options
member.summary: Extended options for the vCard writer.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriter.ProductId
member.summary: The product ID to use when writing a vCard.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardWriterOptions.IgnoreCommas
member.summary: Indicates whether or not commas should be escaped in values.
member.remarks: The vCard specification requires that commas be escaped in values (e.g. a "," is translated to "\,"). However, Microsoft Outlook(tm) does not properly decode these escaped commas. This option instruct the writer to ignored (not translate) embedded commas for better compatibility with Outlook.

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardSubproperty
member.summary: A subproperty of a vCard property.

remarks.para: A vCard is fundamentally a set of properties in NAME:VALUE format, where the name is a keyword like "EMAIL" and the value is a string appropriate for the keyword (e.g. an email address for the EMAIL property, or a BASE64 encoded image for the PHOTO property).

All vCard properties support subproperties. These can be global options like encoding or value type, or might be options specific to the keyword. For example, all vCard properties can have an encoding subproperty that identifies the text encoding of the value. A phone property, however, supports special properties that identify the type and purpose of the phone.

A subproperty is not required to have a value. In such a case the subproperty acts like a flag. For example, the TEL property of the vCard specification is used to indicate a telephone number associated with the person. This property supports a subproperty called BBS, which indicates the telephone number is for a dial-up bulletin board system. The BBS subproperty does not need a value; the existance of the BBS subproperty is sufficient to indicate the telephone number is for a BBS system.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardSubproperty.name
member.summary: Stores the name of the subproperty.

member.name: F:Thought.vCards.vCardSubproperty.value
member.summary: Stores the value of the subproperty. This can be null.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardSubproperty.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a subproperty with the specified name and no value.
member.param: The name of the subproperty.

member.name: M:Thought.vCards.vCardSubproperty.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a subproperty with the specified name and value.
member.param: The name of the subproperty.
The value of the subproperty. This can be null.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.vCardSubproperty.Value
member.summary: The optional value of the subproperty.

remarks.para: This class is a general-purpose collection of objects.

A property of a vCard contains a piece of contact information, such as an email address or web site. A subproperty indicates options or attributes of the property, such as the type of email address or character set.

An initialized vCardProperty object.

member.name: T:Thought.vCards.vCardStandardReader.QuotedPrintableState
member.summary: The state of the quoted-printable decoder (private).
member.remarks: The function is a utility function that parses a string that has been encoded with the QUOTED-PRINTABLE format. The function is implemented as a state-pased parser where the state is updated after examining each character of the input string. This enumeration defines the various states of the parser.

member.summary: The type or classification of a web site.

remarks.para: The Microsoft Outlook contact editor has a field for entering a web site. The default classification of this web site is work-related. A personal web site can be viewed or entered through the All Fields tab.

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.WarningMessages.BlankLine
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Line {0} A blank line was encountered. This is not allowed in the vCard specification..

member.name: P:Thought.vCards.WarningMessages.ColonMissing
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Line {0}: A colon (:) is missing. All properties must be in NAME:VALUE format..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Line {0}: The name section of the property is empty..
